project_descr: Support to the development of institutional & individual capacities needed to execute core public management functions required to sustain the building of a national public service, within an environment of open, structured, & accountable government.

outputs.output_descr: Support to Strengthen the Environment Equality Authority’s Regulatory Function

The Capacity Development Initiative Programme will be one of the key UNDP/PAPP ongoing initiatives and interventions contributing towards enhancing state institutions in Palestine, through focusing on two tracks:-
 a) Institutional development for state building
 b) Capacity development process aimed at enhancing state institutions' effectiveness to deliver services 

The CDI provides the vision and means for delivering a multifaceted national approach for capacity development in a unique way that lends itself to procuring and deploying long term sustainable capacity in the following areas:
1.	Enhance the individual, organizational and institutional capability of the Ministry of Planning and Administrative Development to formulate and implement national development plans (i.e. PRDP) and policies and facilitate and coordinate capacity development at the national level;
2.	Strengthen the individual, organizational and institutional capacity of the General Personnel Council (GPC) to formulate and implement transparent and effective human resource management and human resource development and professional civil service policies and systems;
3.	Enable selected government institutions to implement institutional reform and development and better carry out their functions particularly in delivering improved and better services to the citizens. 
4.	In addition the Capacity Development Initiative Programme will contribute towards :- 
i.	Mainstreaming capacity assessment and Capacity Development approaches
ii.	Development of Institutional capacities for Early Recovery planning & coordination,
iii.	Development of Institutional capacities for establishing a national alert system for responding to crisis
iv.	The development of the senior civil servants to implement National programmes and policies to deliver the PRDP (Palestinian Reform and Development Plan) 
The UNDP Capacity Development Initiative Programme provides a flexible platform and mechanism for developing the Public Administration system in Palestine, in a holistic, coordinated and sustainable way with local ownership.

outputs.output_title: CD of  MoFA  in ICT and ICT ai
outputs.output_descr: This project sets out the support requirements of UNDP/PAPP for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in its efforts to develop its capacities in the filed of ICT and ICT aided management in order to enhance the ministry's ability to achieve its mission among other; to achieve Palstinian foreign policy goals, to improve its ability to shape and coordinate Palestine foreign Policy, to promote Palestinian Interests and values as effectively as possible.

The objectives of the support to the MONE, is to ensure the provision of short term expertise to assist the Ministry to engage in the WTO accession discussions
The support will also include strengthening the capacity of the MONE, in order for it to take on and internalize the major projects and priorities for the MONE in the Government plan, ending the occupation and establishing a state. This involves assistance for the establishment of a Technical Advisor strategic Unit to lead the change management process from within.

To improve the quality and strategic focus of UNDP support to the Palestinian State-building agenda, this Project Initiation Plan includes and assessment of the current UNDP-PAPP governance portfolio, identification of strategic gaps with respect to the different scenarios of the Palestinian State-building ambitions and design a comprehensive programme of support to the Palestinian Authority and other relevant stakeholders. 

State-building, for purpose of the PIP, is understood as an inclusive process focusing on the resilience of the State institutions, their capacity to manage internal conflicts and differences in Palestinian society and their responsiveness to the different needs of the population across the occupied territory. State-building implies more than institution building and should consider systems, levers and environmental factors (legal frameworks, etc.)

The PIP will produce the following two deliverables:
Deliverable / Key Activity 1: Assessment of existing UNDP-PAPP governance portfolio. 
Deliverable / Key Activity 2: Overarching strategy for capacity development and State-building.
